MS MCQs

    Store and retrieve data using literal and variable values in C# - Knowledge Check

    »

    1. Which of the following variable names should or must be avoided?

      $DATA

      registrationComplete

      flag

      yes


    2. What is the problem with this line of code: var message;

      var isn’t a data type.

      Use of var keyword without initializing the variable

      message isn’t a good name for a variable.

      A variable named message should always be a string.


    3. Which of the following lines of code creates a variable correctly.

      int x = 12.3m;

      string x = 12.3m;

      decimal x = 12.3m;

      bool x = ‘False’;
